misuses.description: The use of MD2 as a cryptographic hash function is insecure and should not be used. MD2 is vulnerable to collision attacks and can be used to create a fake message with the same hash value as the original message.
misuses.recommendation: Use a secure cryptographic hash function such as SHA-256, SHA-384, or SHA-512 instead of MD2.

misuses.description: The key used for the encryption is passed as a parameter and is not properly validated. An attacker can use this vulnerability to pass a weak key, which can be easily guessed or brute-forced.
misuses.recommendation: Generate a secure random key and use it for encryption instead of passing a key as a parameter.
